results.title: Randolph Stow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Filmed on location in the landscapes of Suffolk and East Angliam, his present home, Randolf Stow talks of his life and shares examples of his poetry and prose.

results.brief_description: An insightful series of documentary portraits of Australian writers made with the assistance of the Archival Film Program and Literary Arts Board of the Australia Council.

results.title: Roland Robinson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
A poet with a strong attachment to the Australian landscape, Roland Robinson has a deep interest in Aboriginal lore, and performs his poetry with a memorable verve.

results.title: Peter Porter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
From his book-crammed London flat, Peter Porter introduces a variety of his best-known poems and presents his accessible and humane intelligence.
results.description:

results.title: David Malouf: an imaginary life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Poet and novelist David Malouf was filmed in Tuscany, Italy, during the coldest winter there for 50 years, and in Sydney during a steamy summer. To write, he says, you must turn your back on even the most beautiful landscape. Malouf talks about the influences on his work and how he gets into the writing process.

results.title: Form - Genre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Writers on Writing”.
Writers on Writing is based on a growing archive of video material, of conversations between contemporary writers discussing their work. The material has been re-edited to form a resource for students and teachers of English, and each of the six twenty-minute videos focuses on different aspects and stages of the writing process. Each video is accompanied by a resource booklet. In this video, a discussion about the difference between writing novels, poems and screenplays is followed by a section on genre, which concentrates on crime writing, science fiction, fairy tales and myths.

group_siblings.title: Beginnings - Inspiration - the Role of the Writer

results.title: Beginnings - Inspiration - the Role of the Writer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Writers on Writing”.
This series is based on a growing archive of video material of conversations between contemporary writers discussing their work. The material has been re-edited to form a resource for students and teachers of English, and each of the six twenty-minute videos focuses on different aspects and stages of the writing process. Each video is accompanied by a resource booklet. In this video, writers talk about how they began to write, what their inspiration is and their perception of the writer’s role.

results.title: Language - audience
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Writers on Writing”.
Writers on Writing is based on a growing archive of video material, of conversations between contemporary writers discussing their work. The material has been re-edited to form a resource for students and teachers of English, and each of the six twenty-minute videos focuses on different aspects and stages of the writing process. Each video is accompanied by a resource booklet. In this final video of the series, the use of language is investigated, followed by a discussion on the importance of “audience” for the writer.
